text:
There is a problem in defining the target for a pattern which is to be declared
under the Redirect clause in the httpd.conf file. Suppose, someone has a
requirement of redirecting any request for
http://servername:serverport/filename.jsp to
http://servername:serverport/appname/filename.jsp in the Redirect clause, he/she
must specify the complete URL in the target section. It should not be made
mandatory. Rather, if not specified, it should assume the current HTTP_HOST as
the server name. Trying to use HTTP_HOST in stead of hardcoding the server name
also doesn't work for some reason.
creator: tapanjyotib@yahoo.com

text:
This now works something like what you suggest, although I'm not sure if it is
only in 2.0.

But in any case, the usual response to "please make Redirect more flexible" is
"try mod_rewrite", since it can do this easily.
